title: Application of Realistic and Gradual Instructional Methods for Mental Arithmetic Education for Adults

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic arithmetic operations and foundational understanding of number systems
context.additional_context: Part of a workplace efficiency improvement program for professionals, featuring personalized device usage and flexible learning schedules

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more flexible problem-solving strategies using empty number line models for addition/subtraction problems within 100
Learners can select appropriate mental arithmetic strategies for real-world problem-solving and describe the application process
In formative assessments, learners perform procedural calculations with over 80% accuracy and can compare/analyze two or more calculation methods
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
